rev.comment: /* Statements regarding President Obama */ shorten newbie comment not yet ready for inclusion, rm extra spaces
rev.diff:
Line 197: Line 197:
In an April, 2011 NBC interview, Trump claimed he had sent people to Hawaii to investigate Obama's citizenship, commenting "they cannot believe what they're finding."<ref>{{cite news|url=http://articles.nydailynews.com/2011-04-07/news/29412491_1_donald-trump-president-obama-hawaii|title=Donald Trump, wannabe President: I've sent investigators to Hawaii to look into Obama's citizenship|date=April 7, 2011|work=[[Daily News (New York)|Daily News]]|accessdate=May 14, 2011}}</ref> On [[Anderson Cooper 360]] on [[CNN]] April 25, 2011, Trump said he wanted Obama to end the issue by releasing his long-form Certificate of Live Birth (distinct from the short-form Certification of Live Birth – Hawaii's prima facie evidence of birth), adding, "I've been told very recently ... the birth certificate is missing."<ref>{{cite news|url=http://ac360.blogs.cnn.com/2011/04/25/trump-claims-obama-birth-certificate-missing/|title=Trump claims Obama birth certificate 'missing'|date=April 25, 2011|work=[[CNN]]|accessdate=May 14, 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title= Birtherism: Where It All Began|url= http://www.politico.com/news/stories/0411/53563_Page3.html |work=The Politico |date=April 22, 2011 |accessdate=April 25, 2011}}</ref> Trump received criticism from both the political right and left in the media for his stance.<ref name=Politico33011>{{Cite news|last=Haberman |first=Maggie |title=Bill O'Reilly pounds birther Donald Trump |url=http://www.politico.com/news/stories/0311/52271.html |date=March 30, 2011|work=Polico.com|separator=,|postscript=|accessdate=April 13, 2011}}</ref> On April 27, 2011, the long-form of Obama's birth certificate was released by the White House. Obama said it should put the matter to rest; that the nation had more pressing problems to solve and could not afford to be "distracted by side shows and carnival barkers".<ref>[http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2011/04/27/obama-birth-certificate-r_n_854248.html Obama Birth Certificate Released By White House (PHOTO)].''Huffington Post'' April 27, 2011. Retrieved May 8, 2011.</ref>
In an April, 2011 NBC interview, Trump claimed he had sent people to Hawaii to investigate Obama's citizenship, commenting "they cannot believe what they're finding."<ref>{{cite news|url=http://articles.nydailynews.com/2011-04-07/news/29412491_1_donald-trump-president-obama-hawaii|title=Donald Trump, wannabe President: I've sent investigators to Hawaii to look into Obama's citizenship|date=April 7, 2011|work=[[Daily News (New York)|Daily News]]|accessdate=May 14, 2011}}</ref> On [[Anderson Cooper 360]] on [[CNN]] April 25, 2011, Trump said he wanted Obama to end the issue by releasing his long-form Certificate of Live Birth (distinct from the short-form Certification of Live Birth – Hawaii's prima facie evidence of birth), adding, "I've been told very recently ... the birth certificate is missing."<ref>{{cite news|url=http://ac360.blogs.cnn.com/2011/04/25/trump-claims-obama-birth-certificate-missing/|title=Trump claims Obama birth certificate 'missing'|date=April 25, 2011|work=[[CNN]]|accessdate=May 14, 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title= Birtherism: Where It All Began|url= http://www.politico.com/news/stories/0411/53563_Page3.html |work=The Politico |date=April 22, 2011 |accessdate=April 25, 2011}}</ref> Trump received criticism from both the political right and left in the media for his stance.<ref name=Politico33011>{{Cite news|last=Haberman |first=Maggie |title=Bill O'Reilly pounds birther Donald Trump |url=http://www.politico.com/news/stories/0311/52271.html |date=March 30, 2011|work=Polico.com|separator=,|postscript=|accessdate=April 13, 2011}}</ref> On April 27, 2011, the long-form of Obama's birth certificate was released by the White House. Obama said it should put the matter to rest; that the nation had more pressing problems to solve and could not afford to be "distracted by side shows and carnival barkers".<ref>[http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2011/04/27/obama-birth-certificate-r_n_854248.html Obama Birth Certificate Released By White House (PHOTO)].''Huffington Post'' April 27, 2011. Retrieved May 8, 2011.</ref>
Trump expressed pride at his role in the release of the long-form certificate in a press conference followup.<ref>[http://www.cbsnews.com/8301-503544_162-20057854-503544.html Trump takes credit for Obama birth certificate release, but wonders "is it real?"] CBS News April 27, 2011. Retrieved May 9, 2011.</ref>
Trump expressed pride at his role in the release of the long-form certificate in a press conference followup.<ref>[http://www.cbsnews.com/8301-503544_162-20057854-503544.html Trump takes credit for Obama birth certificate release, but wonders "is it real?"] CBS News April 27, 2011. Retrieved May 9, 2011.</ref>
â
+
<!-- In fairness to Trump, we might want to mention the killing of Bin Laden, and may have also contributed to the poll drop -->
â   â
<!-- As the "birther" issue that he championed started fading with the release of President Barack Obama's birth certificate, which occurred on the same weekend as President Obama's historic announcement of the US military's successful capture and killing of international terrorist Osama Bin Laden, so did Trump's popularity. -->
  â  
Public Policy Polling described the events as "one of the quickest rises and falls in the history of presidential politics", saying:
Public Policy Polling described the events as "one of the quickest rises and falls in the history of presidential politics", saying:
:''"Trump really made hay out of the 'birther' issue and as the resonance of that has declined, so has his standing. In February we found that 51% of Republican primary voters thought Barack Obama was not born in the United States. Now with the release of his birth certificate only 34% of GOP partisans fall into that camp, and Trump's only in fifth place with that now smaller group of the electorate at 9%"''<ref>[http://publicpolicypolling.blogspot.com/2011/05/trump-collapses.html]</ref>
:''"Trump really made hay out of the 'birther' issue and as the resonance of that has declined, so has his standing. In February we found that 51% of Republican primary voters thought Barack Obama was not born in the United States. Now with the release of his birth certificate only 34% of GOP partisans fall into that camp, and Trump's only in fifth place with that now smaller group of the electorate at 9%"''<ref>[http://publicpolicypolling.blogspot.com/2011/05/trump-collapses.html]</ref>
